column4: yeah, this is more pebkac on his end :) i'm trying to have him understand what i'm saying.
Most likely a bios 'feature', not an issue. If it's a newer mainboard there'll be a button you can press for 'boot options', where you can select your boot device.
yeah. the issue is i'm doing this remotely and he doesn't know what i'm talking about :( i'll try. seems like a bios issue.
Most likely F8, F10 or F12. If there's no such option, you'll have to enter the bios and prioritize booting from dvd over hdd.
